intro: Siphocranion flavidum, commonly known as the yellow starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, yellowish-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access water from deeper soil layers. Siphocranion flavidum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
